rows.title: Source of Strength
rows.titleText:
First, we need to establish your current Nascent Fragments total.

Add 3 as a baseline, then add 1 for each Mythic Point you currently have stored.

(If you are a Demon and wish to choose to continue being a Demon, add +1 Point as well)

objects.title: Nascent Fragments
objects.text: Feint whispers of ancients strength; the mysteries of how to unlock their potential, jealously guarded by powers beyond comprehension

objects.title: Blossoming Fragments
objects.text: The flame of your soul rises, raising you to feats no mortal could hope to achieve; as your power grows - it will inevitably invite challengers

objects.title: Sparks of Divinity
objects.text: True Power. There is no other term for it. All these years you thought wealth and material strength was the thing worth fighting for; how could you ever know the essence of creation was within anyone's reach

rows.title: Embodiment of Self
rows.titleText:
Before we can talk about who you are going to be, we first need to address what exactly you are... in one moment you were something, but now in another, you can be something else

Reality is rather malleable where the divine is involved

objects.title: Demon
objects.text: By expending a fragment, you may immediately reform your own essence as a Demon of The Egregore

objects.title: Revenant
objects.text: The default choice, harboring fragments of a god will naturally make you a Revenant. Note: This is the default option, even if you were already a Demon of a different deity

objects.title: Mortal
objects.text: Whilst normally impossible to revert back to mortality once someone ascends to a Revenant, your nascent fragments allow you some wiggle room in the cosmic order

rows.title: Expression of Divinity
rows.titleText: This is a row, and inside of it, you can place choices. On both rows and choices Requirements can be placed, which will block a row from being viewed, or make the player unable to select a choice, depending on either Point-types or the Ids of other choices. Point-types can be made in Features then Manage Points. Hovering over buttons will explain what they do. The Design of the project can be changed in 'Modify Design' at the side navigation bar, and private styling for each row can be turned on in the rows Settings. Default text like this can be turned off in Features -> Manage Defaults.

objects.title: Body
objects.text:
The Martial Path, walk it, and you will push your body to its metaphysical limits. No mountain too tall, no river too angry; no distance too long.

At the Nascent Stage, your options will enable you to achieve the zenith of mortal limitations within the realm of the body

objects.title: Mind
objects.text:
The Psionic Path, walk it, and your thoughts will become your greatest weapon. Telekinesis will become second nature; projection and suggestive thought, effortless.

At the Nascent Stage, your options will allow you to manipulate both the battlefield, and other characters in ways normally unavailable for player characters

objects.title: Spirit
objects.text:
The Spell Path, walk it, and you will learn spells and rituals that take most magi a lifetime of study; in mere minutes. No tool is greater than a soul put to purpose

At the Nascent Stage, your options will allow you to become highly gifted in one or more spheres of magic, unlocking ways to manipulate them that would usually require a Master Class

rows.title: Nascent Powers
rows.titleText: “The flesh was never weak. It simply waited for permission.”

objects.title: Titan's Frame
objects.text:
All Your Athletics Checks gain a +10 Modifier

"Your tendons remember a strength you never earned"

objects.title: The Beast At The Gate
objects.text:
All Your Intimidation Checks gain a +10 Modifier

“Whatever stepped into your skin wasn’t human. But it wears you well.”

objects.title: Lightning-Taught
objects.text:
All Your Reflex Checks gain a +10 Modifier

“It moves before you think. That’s not training — that’s intrusion.”

objects.title: Shadow-Blooded
objects.text:
All Your Stealth Checks gain a +10 Modifier

“You don’t enter shadows. You return to them.”

objects.title: Fell Dancer
objects.text:
All Your Acrobatics Checks gain a +10 Modifier

“Your bones remember rhythms you never learned.”

objects.title: The Unheld
objects.text:
All Your Escape Artist Checks gain a +10 Modifier

“Nothing holds you — not chains, not knots, not fate.”

objects.title: ron Soul, Iron Flesh
objects.text:
All Your Endurance Checks gain a +10 Modifier

“Your pain doesn’t scream anymore. It obeys.”

objects.title: Whispers of the Wrist
objects.text:
All Your Sleight of Hand Checks gain a +10 Modifier

“Fingers that don’t feel like yours still move at your command.”

objects.title: Fleet-Blooded
objects.text:
Your Movement is increased by +5 Tiles

“It isn’t fear that makes you fast. It’s instinct honed until even terror can’t keep up.”

objects.title: Iron Will, Iron Sinew
objects.text:
Whenever you would gain Exhaustion, instead you gain that much -1 instead

“Pain is the whisper. Endurance is the answer.”

objects.title: Serrated Reflex
objects.text:
Whenever a none-magical, none-split-second attack or ability misses you; you may move 2 tiles

“The body sees before the mind catches up. Learn to listen.”

objects.title: Breathing Anchor
objects.text:
If you are stationary; you cannot be knocked back, shoved or forced to move by brute force, from any Target that is 6x6 or smaller

“The mountain does not flinch.”

objects.title: Predatory Gait
objects.text:
You can move through tiles occupied by enemies without penalty. You ignore increased movement costs from moving adjacent to Enemies

“It doesn’t move like a warrior. It moves like something that should not be caged.”

objects.title: Battlefield Rhytm
objects.text:
You ignore all disadvantage, negative modifiers; and movement penalties incurred by different Terrain.

“The earth itself stands aside, for those who would reach for divinity"

objects.title: Quiet Core
objects.text:
The first Attack you make each round does not break your Stealth

“Stillness is a weapon when wielded with patience"

objects.title: Hunter-In-Chaos
objects.text:
At the start of your Turn, you may immediately attempt to move Adjacent to any Target you damaged since the start of your previous Turn. If you are able to do so, your Movement points and Action is refunded.

“Once the heart locks on, the legs will not fail it.”

rows.title: Nascent Powers
rows.titleText: The world listens when the mind speaks

objects.title: Sight Unclouded
objects.text:
All Your Perception Checks gain a +10 Modifier

“The world stops hiding things from you.”

objects.title: Tongue of Scales
objects.text:
All Your Mercantile Checks gain a +10 Modifier

“Every number they speak is weighed before they finish the word.”

objects.title: Perfect Mark
objects.text:
All Your Bluff Checks gain a +10 Modifier

The lie feels true before you even speak it.”

objects.title: Stage-Born
objects.text:
All Your Perform Checks gain a +10 Modifier

“They aren’t clapping for you. They’re clapping because they have no choice.”

objects.title: Silver Dominion
objects.text:
All Your Persuasion Checks gain a +10 Modifier

“Your words sound like the thoughts they were about to have.”

objects.title: Stillpoint Mind
objects.text:
All Your Concentration Checks gain a +10 Modifier

"The noise falls away. Even your heartbeat knows not to intrude.”

objects.title: The Hand Not Yours
objects.text:
All Your Forgery Checks gain a +10 Modifier

“Another’s hand guides yours, and it is perfect.”

objects.title: Vein-Seeker
objects.text:
All Your Investigation Checks gain a +10 Modifier

“Threads you never noticed before now knot themselves into answers.”

objects.title: Minor Kinetic Bias
objects.text:
You can move unattended objects weighing less than 5kg 2 tiles per round as a free action. You may pull handheld objects from within 2 tiles into your open hand

"It's not that the object moved. It's that it wanted to"

objects.title: Disruption of Thought
objects.text:
All Enemy Targets passively gain -5 to their Concentration Rolls

“You don’t speak. But something about your presence makes their thoughts unravel.”

objects.title: Immaculate Focus
objects.text:
You suffer no penalty for Concentration checks while maintaining a spell, Psionic channel or prolonged action

“One hand prays. One hand plots. The mind does both.”

objects.title: Imposed Calm
objects.text:
Allies within 5 Tiles of you gain +10 to Will Checks against Fear and Terror unless you are visibly panicked.

“Even in silence, your presence slows the pulse.”

objects.title: Eyes Without Sound
objects.text:
You are always aware of the number of minds within 3 tiles, regardless of sight. You are immediately made aware when one becomes focused on you

“You can’t see them. But they’re there — and you feel the weight of their thoughts.”

objects.title: Eyes Without Sound
objects.text:
You are always aware of the number of minds within 3 tiles, regardless of sight. You are immediately made aware when one becomes focused on you

“You can’t see them. But they’re there — and you feel the weight of their thoughts.”

objects.title: Telekinetic Arsenal
objects.text:
Maintain one weapon and one shield telekinetically, freeing your hands. Attacks and blocks function as normal, and melee reach increases by 2 tiles.

“The hands are for expression. The will is for war.”

objects.title: Iron Halo
objects.text:
Use a Reaction to intercept a ranged attack within 8 tiles using telekinetically-flung debris, weapons, or shields. Roll Accuracy; on a success, the attack is negated.

“Your defense is as far as your will can reach.”

rows.title: Nascent Powers
rows.titleText: “The soul does not grow — it remembers what it should be.”

objects.title: Arcane
objects.text: The Weave bends for the one who knows where to pull

objects.title: Earth
objects.text: Stone remembers every step ever taken

objects.title: Fire
objects.text: Flame does not forgive, but it always answers.

objects.title: Frost
objects.text: Cold does not kill - it convinces you to stop moving

objects.title: Lightning
objects.text: The sky does not grant power. It delivers judgment

objects.title: Nature
objects.text: The root and fang answer only to the law before time

objects.title: Necropotency
objects.text: Death is only the silence between breaths

objects.title: Water
objects.text: The sea does not yield. It waits for you to tire

objects.title: Wind
objects.text: You cannot hold the wind, but it can carry you

rows.title: Arcana
rows.titleText: I no longer touch the weave. I stand as one of its threads

objects.title: Sigil Rift
objects.text:
Whenever you cast a spell, faint glyphs shimmer around you. Once per scene, you may anchor one of these sigils to a surface within 3 tiles. The next spell you cast can originate from that sigil instead of from yourself.

“The weave does not know where I end, only where I inscribe it.”

objects.title: Counterthread
objects.text:
As a Reaction, when a creature within 8 tiles casts a spell, force them to roll Concentration(10+YourINT). On a failure, the spell fizzles.

“The pattern breaks when I pull the wrong stitch.”

objects.title: Spellweaver's Reach
objects.text:
All of your Spells have their range extended by your Intelligence Modifier

“The thread stretches further when pulled with certainty.”

objects.title: Spellweaver's Reach
objects.text:
All of your Spells have their range extended by your Intelligence Modifier

“The thread stretches further when pulled with certainty.”

objects.title: Null Stitch
objects.text:
Target a Creature within 5 Tiles. Their next Spell or Magical Ability costs +50 Mana; and silences them when used

“Every pattern has a knot. Pull it, and the whole weave resists.”

objects.title: Aetheric Step
objects.text:
Move at Split-Second Speed up to 3 tiles in any direction, you must be able to see the destination

“The weave folds, and I am on the other side.”

objects.title: Arcane Frenzy
objects.text:
Once Per Combat, you may increase the range or area of a spell you cast by your Intelligence Modifier.

“The pattern holds more thread than most dare to pull.”

rows.title: Earth
rows.titleText: The stone does not carry me. It is my own weight I walk upon

objects.title: Stonebound
objects.text:
While standing on natural ground or stone, you gain +5 Constitution, Reflex and Will.

“The stone does not move — and neither will you.”

objects.title: Earthen Grasp
objects.text:
Whenever you cast a spell, a hand-sized stone raises from the ground and hovers around you. As a Free Action you may unleash all such stones in a flurry towards a Target, dealing 1d4 Earth Damage for each stone fired

“The earth offers its fists freely.”

objects.title: Seismic Push
objects.text:
Choose a Target within 5 tiles standing on natural ground. They must succeed on a Strength save (10+Str/Int) or be shoved 4 tiles directly away and take 2d4 Bludgeoning damage. They take an additional 10d4 Bludgeoning Damage if they crash with an object or terrain.

The stone beneath them grows tired of holding their weight.”

objects.title: Burden of Stone
objects.text:
Target a creature within 5 tiles. Their attacks deal -3 damage until the end of their next turn, as invisible weight drags at their limbs.

“Stone teaches all who carry it: strength is borrowed, not owned.”

objects.title: Choice
objects.text:
Strike the ground. All creatures within 6 tiles of you must succeed on a Reflex(10+Str/Int) or be knocked Prone.

“The earth beneath you does not belong to you.”

objects.title: Stone Skin
objects.text:
While active, your movement is reduced by any amount; you gain armor equal to the reduced amount.

“Flesh is weak only until it remembers the stone beneath it.”

objects.title: Earthen Bulwark
objects.text:
Raise a slab of stone from the ground within 2 tiles. Provides cover until destroyed (HP = 5+Int)

“Walls do not need builders. Only will.”

rows.title: Fire
rows.titleText: I burn, and the world makes way for the heat

objects.title: Growing Inferno
objects.text:
Whenever you deal Fire Damage, add +1 Damage to it, this number grows by 1 each time you have dealt Fire Damage this combat

“Every flame is born eager to grow.”

objects.title: Ashen Endurance
objects.text:
When you would suffer Burning, reduce the damage to 0 and extinguish it instantly

“Flame has already claimed you. It will not waste itself trying again.”

objects.title: Smoldering Presence
objects.text:
Once per round, when a creature enters melee range, it takes 1 Fire damage.

“Even standing near you feels like leaning too close to the hearth.”

objects.title: Emberwake
objects.text:
You can ignite or snuff out small flames within 3 tiles as a free action. You can also ignite unattended flammable objects

“What fire hears, it obeys.”

objects.title: Flame Jet
objects.text:
Exhale a flame in a 4-tile line. All creatures in the line takes 1 Fire Damage. Flammable terrain ignites

“Direction is the only difference between warmth and weapon.”

objects.title: Blazing Surge
objects.text:
As an Anytime Action, double the current bonus of your Growing Inferno

“The strike is nothing. The flame after it is everything.”

objects.title: Blazing Surge
objects.text:
Target a 2x2 Area within 6 Tiles. All creatures take 1 Fire Damage. At the start of your next turn, the fire spreads randomly by 4 tiles, then repeats the damage.

Control is a lie. Fire answers only itself.”

rows.title: Frost
rows.titleText: The stillness is mine now — and nothing moves without my leave

objects.title: Cold-Blooded
objects.text:
You ignore the first 2 points of Exhaustion you currently have.

“The chill enters, but never leaves.”

objects.title: Hoarfrost Veil
objects.text:
When struck by a melee attack, the attacker suffers -5 Accuracy until the end of their next turn

“Cold clings to those who touch it.”

objects.title: Iceborn
objects.text:
The first time you would suffer the Frozen or Slowed condition each scene, you ignore it.

“Ice does not freeze its own.”

objects.title: Crystalline Focus
objects.text:
You gain +10 to Concentration checks while standing still.

“The mind sharpens where the body stills.”

objects.title: Shardspray
objects.text:
Target a 3-tile Cone. Targets inside take 1d4 Cold Damage and suffer -4 Accuracy on their next attack

“The shards don’t kill. They make what follows easier.”

objects.title: Icy Veins
objects.text:
As an Anytime, you may clear yourself of up to 20 Bleeding Stacks

“Slow blood does not spill quickly.”

objects.title: Icy Veins
objects.text:
Create a blinding haze in a 2x2 range within 5 tiles. Targets inside are Blind until the end of their next turn

“The storm is never in the sky. It is in your eyes.”

rows.title: Lightning
rows.titleText: Judgment no longer falls from above — it arrives where I stand.

objects.title: Stormstep
objects.text:
Once Per Round, when you sprint, you can move +6 Tiles.

"The storm walks faster than any man can run"

objects.title: Stormstep
objects.text:
When you enter Combat, all enemies must succeed on a Will(10+Presence) or suffer Shaken for 1 Round

“The storm announces itself. So do I.”

objects.title: Flash-Eyed
objects.text:
Gain +5 on rolls to avoid fast-moving objects like Arrows or Thrown Weapons.

“Nothing outruns the sky’s attention.”

objects.title: Shock Lance
objects.text:
Target a creature within 5 Tiles. They take 4d8 Lightning Damage. On a failed Endurance(12) they also lose their next Reaction 

“It doesn’t wound. It interrupts.”

objects.title: Chain Arc
objects.text:
Target a creature within 4 Tiles. They and up to 2 additional creatures within 4 Tiles of them each take 3d8 Lightning Damage

“The bolt never strikes alone.”

objects.title: Flash Step
objects.text:
Instantly move to the closest high ground; whilst remaining in that tile, your Range is increased by +8

“The horizon shortens when you carry the storm.”

objects.title: Rolling Thunder
objects.text:
Create a low thunderclap in a 2-tile radius within 4 Tiles. All creature inside must succeed on a Will(15) or suffer Shaken until the start of your next turn

Even when the bolt misses, the sound does not.”

rows.title: Nature
rows.titleText: I am not apart from the wild. I am its law made flesh

objects.title: Predator's Gaze
objects.text:
When you damage a Target, you gain +2 to your next Intimidate check against it

"Every beast knows when it is being hunted.”

objects.title: Forager's Instinct
objects.text:
You can identify edible plants, fungi, and fresh water, even in areas you've never been. Grants +30 Survival in natural terrain.

“The wild does not starve its own.”

objects.title: Beast Tongue
objects.text:
You may communicate basic intent (fear, hunger, calm, aggression) to animals and insects.

“They do not speak words. They speak truth.”

objects.title: Symbiotic Flesh
objects.text:
When you would take Poison Damage, reduce it to 0 and remove all stacks 

“The wild has already made you part of its cycle.”

objects.title: Predatory Surge
objects.text:
As an Anytime Action, you may add +4 Movement and +8 Damage to your next melee attack this turn. Both numbers are improved by Predator's Gaze

“The beast runs faster when it smells blood.”

objects.title: Roar of The Apex
objects.text:
All hostile creatures must roll Fear(10+Presence). All Animal Companions under your control immediately enter a frenzy and charge the closest Feared Enemy, granting themselves Overwhelm

“The hunt has found you. Now we tear.”

rows.title: Necropotency
rows.titleText: Death is the space I walk through to reach the living

objects.title: Grave-Touched
objects.text:
You are Immune to Fear and Terror effects

“When you’ve seen the grave, nothing else frightens you.”

objects.title: Gravetongue
objects.text:
You can whisper to the dead, sensing a fragment of their final thought. Usable once per corpse.

“The lips rot, but the memory never does.”

objects.title: Omen's Shadow
objects.text:
You radiate an unsettling aura. Enemies within 4 tiles loose -3 Initiative

“The shadow does not follow you. It waits for you.”

objects.title: Death's Grasp
objects.text:
Target a creature within 5 Tiles. Deal 3d6 Necrotic Damage, and regain Health equal to half the damage dealt.

“Their pulse becomes yours, if only for a moment.”

objects.title: Hex of Weakness
objects.text:
Target a creature within 5 tiles. Until the end of their next turn, their attacks deal -10 damage.

“Strength is a loan. The grave collects interest.”

objects.title: Wasting Touch
objects.text:
A Target within 5 Tiles takes 2d6 Necrotic damage and suffers -10 to Concentration until the end of their next turn. If their Concentration fails, they take another 2d6 Necrotic Damage

“What the touch doesn’t take, it makes too heavy to carry.”

objects.title: Curse of Frailty
objects.text:
Target creature within 5 Tiles take 50% more damage from all sources until the start of your next Turn

“Their bones remember how near the earth waits.”

rows.title: Water
rows.titleText: The tide does not turn for me. I am the tide.

objects.title: Flowstep
objects.text:
You may move through enemies; and you do not suffer movement penalties for moving adjacent to enemies.

"The tide does not ask permission to pass"

objects.title: Amphibious
objects.text:
You may breathe water and swim at full movement speed.

“The air is useful. It is not necessary.”

objects.title: Driftborn
objects.text:
When you would suffer Fall Damage, you instead take 1d6 Bludgeoning Damage as water cushions your body

“The current remembers how to catch you.”

objects.title: Slick Veil
objects.text:
You may at will coat yourself in a sheen of water, gaining +10 to Escape Artist checks until the end of your turn

“Nothing clings when the current pulls.”

objects.title: Cleansing Surge
objects.text:
A Target Ally within 4 Tiles is immediately cured of your choice of 1 Negative Status Effect

“The tide washes away what should not linger.”

objects.title: Drown Grip
objects.text:
Target a creature within 4 Tiles. They must succeed on a Constitution(10+Int) or begin choking - suffering -5 Accuracy until the end of their next turn

“The lungs remember what they were before breath.”

objects.title: Restorative Tide
objects.text:
Target Ally within 8 tiles regain 3d6 Health. If they are suffering from Bleeding or Burning, those conditions are also removed.

“The tide does not only drag away. It returns what was lost.”

rows.title: Wind
rows.titleText: The air carries me because it no longer knows where i end

objects.title: Gale Step
objects.text:
Whilst moving, you may choose to have that moment count as Shifting

"Feet that carry the storm never stumble"

objects.title: Whispertrail
objects.text:
Whilst moving you generate no sound audible beyond 1 tile. Grants +10 Stealth while in motion

“Even the air forgets you when you pass.”

objects.title: Whispertrail
objects.text:
You gain +10 Acrobatics when balancing, leaping or moving across unstable or rough terrain

“The gale does not fall. It dances.”

objects.title: Whispertrail
objects.text:
Target a 4x4 Area within 10 Tiles. All Creatures inside must succeed on a Reflex(15) or be shoved 2 tiles in a random direction

“The gale has no loyalty to formation.”

objects.title: Cyclone Grip
objects.text:
Target a 2x2 Area. Unattended smaller objects, and Creatures of size Small or smaller are lifted. Becoming immobilized until the end of their next turn.

“What the wind takes, it does not return easily.”

objects.title: Air Rend
objects.text:
Compress a razor edge of wind to strike a creature within 2 tiles. Deals 4d6 Slashing damage.

“The sky hides blades in its breath.”

objects.title: Gust
objects.text:
Push a creature within 5 Tiles back 1 Tile. If they fail a Strength(12) save, they are also knocked Prone

“The gentlest air is still stronger than pride.”

defaultRowText: This is a row, and inside of it, you can place choices. On both rows and choices Requirements can be placed, which will block a row from being viewed, or make the player unable to select a choice, depending on either Point-types or the Ids of other choices. Point-types can be made in Features then Manage Points. Hovering over buttons will explain what they do. The Design of the project can be changed in 'Modify Design' at the side navigation bar, and private styling for each row can be turned on in the rows Settings. Default text like this can be turned off in Features -> Manage Defaults.
defaultChoiceText: This is a Choice, and inside of it, you can place images and text. Scores can be added to it, and have Point-types attached. Addons can be added underneath the image and text. In the Functions at the bottom of the choice, there is an array of different things that can be done. Default text like this can be turned off in Features then Manage Defaults.
defaultAddonText: Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry's standard dummy text ever since the 1500s, when an unknown printer took a galley of type and scrambled it to make a type specimen book. It has survived not only five centuries, but also the leap into electronic typesetting, remaining essentially unchanged. It was popularised in the 1960s with the release of Letraset sheets containing Lorem Ipsum passages, and more recently with desktop publishing software like Aldus PageMaker including versions of Lorem Ipsum.
